comment.author: 29350288@N06
comment._content:
Edgar Z. Steever was promoted to Brig. General in August 1912 and Gen. Huerta became president of Mexico in Feb 1913. The titles given in the caption suggests photo between those dates.

Joaquín Téllez was governor of the Mexican state of Sonora.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
Found a similar version of this photo in El Paso Herald issue september 12, 1912 (Library of Congress, newspapers, Cronicling America).  Above is written:  "United States and Mexican Army Officer On The Border"; below:  "Left to right, those in the photgraph are: Gen. Victoriano Huerta commanding the army of northern Mexico, Gen. E. Z. Steever, U. S. , commanding the Department of Texas. and The United States border guard; Col. Frank West commanding the Second Cavalry and Fort Bliss; Gen. Joaquin Tellez, second command of federal army of northern Mexico and Col. D. A. Frederick commanding 22d infantry U.S.A. on American border patrol duty.
Dr. Roberto Duarte

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: The El Paso herald., September 06, 1912, Page 5 reported that Gen. Victoriano Huerta, Gen. Joaquin Tellez and others paid a visit to Gen. E. Z. Steever. Steever visited Huerta in Juarez a few days before, see El Paso herald., September 05, 1912, Image 1, Col. 4.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Another photo of Steever: See comments there

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: Thanks to all who contributed to identifying the people and the occasion. We can add some information when we next update the description.
